p: The free radical scavenging activity of V. officinalis extracts ( Vo-C, Vo-S, Vo-STB, and Vo-in vivo) was determined using the DPPH (1,1-diphenyl-2-picrylhydrazyl) method [ 69]. An aliquot (0.5 mL) of a methanol solution containing a different amount of each extract (0.0625–2 mg/mL) was added to 3 mL of daily prepared methanol DPPH solution (0.1 mM). The optical density change at 517 nm was measured, 20 min after the initial mixing, with a model UV-1601 spectrophotometer (Shimadzu). Butylated hydroxytoluene (BHT) was used as a reference.The results, obtained from the average of three independent experiments, are reported as mean radical scavenging activity percentage (%) ± SD and mean 50% inhibitory concentration (IC 50) ± SD.
